titles.title: Marvel Not That Christ In Glory (easy nice)

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Marvel not that Christ in glory All my inmost heart hath won Not a star to cheer my darkness But a light beyond the sun{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}All below lies dark and shadowed Nothing there to claim my heart Save the lonely track of sorrow Where of old He walked apart I was journeying in the noontide, When His light shone o'er my road; And I saw Him in that glory- Saw Him-Jesus, Son of God. All around, in noonday splendour Earthly scenes lay fair and bright But my eyes no longer see them For the glory of that light{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Others in the summer sunshine Wearily may journey on I have seen a light from heaven Past the brightness of the sun Light that knows no cloud no waning Light wherein I see His face All His love's uncounted treasures All the riches of His grace{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Sinners it was not to Angels All this wondrous love was given But to one who scorned despised Him Scorned and hated Christ in heaven From the lowest depths of evil To the throne in heaven above Thus in me He told the measure Of His free, unbounded love{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}All the wonders of His glory Deeper wonders of His love How for me He won He keepeth That high place in Heaven above Not a glimpse - the veil uplifted But within the veil to dwell Gazing on His face forever Hearing words unspeakable{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}I have seen the face of Jesus Tell me not of aught beside I have heard the voice of Jesus All my soul is satisfied In the radiance of the glory First I saw His blessed face And forever shall that glory Be my home my dwelling place{/lang-eng}
